message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL 

This paper deals with computer vision tasks such as action recognition and proposes a pipeline using a large-scale training source to achieve a Universal Representation (UR) that can generalise to a more realistic Cross-Dataset UAR (CD-UAR) scenario. Therefore, it is most likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as Generalised Multiple-Instance Learning (GMIL) and semantic adaptation, which makes it likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper deals with video data, which makes it relevant to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves semantic components, which makes it relevant to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) sub-category.
